post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I downloaded VS2008 ISO file and I can't 'explore' it, what do I use to open them and run a executable so I can install it?

I am using Vista...

post.author: iceheart
post.body: You can extract ISO files with winrar, among other programs. You can also mount them with a virtual drive like Deamon Tools, or you could burn it to a disc with pretty much any burning app in the world.

post.author: Bittoman
post.body:
ISO format is just a file based image of the filesystem and structure of a CD or DVD, the above mentioned methods work fine but I'd recommend burning it to a disc.

If you have a CD burner just download CDBurnerXP and burn it to a disc.

http://www.download.com/CDBurnerXP/3000 ... 09086.html

post.author: der_ton
post.body: If you don't need to have it on a physical disc, I'd say burning it would be a waste of time and the disc. Mounting the ISO as virtual disc (with Daemontools or similar) or opening it with an iso explorer tool has no disadvantages and gives you faster access (HDs are faster than disc drives).

post.author: Burrito
post.body:
Yes, don't burn - mount.

http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/windows- ... ows-vista/
